meanings.definition: A device used to close an opening or passage
meanings.sent1: The obturators were placed in the pipeline to stop the water flow.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used obturators to seal the leak in the pipe.
meanings.sent3: The obturators decided to take a break from closing openings and went on a vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted like obturators, sealing off any sadness that tried to enter her heart.
meanings.sent5: The obturators clicked shut, locking the treasure chest securely.

meanings.definition: A muscle that closes an opening in the body
meanings.sent1: The obturators in his jaw helped him chew his food.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, the obturators in the legs contract to support movement.
meanings.sent3: The obturators in his stomach decided to do a dance every time he laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the obturators in her mind, shutting out any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The obturators in his throat tightened as he swallowed the bitter medicine.
